snippet: The mistake, was likely to have contributed to confusion the F.B.I. had about the drug arrest in February of Dylann Roof, the man charged last month in the killing of nine people in Charleston, S.C.
abstract: Law enforcement authorities in South Carolina say administrative error played role in gun sale to Dylann Storm Roof, suspect in Charleston shooting massacre that left nine congregants in historically black church dead; Roof was able to purchase firearm through loophole in federal gun control laws after clerical error caused delay in getting information to FBI offices responsible for approving or blocking the sale.
lead_paragraph: The mistake, was likely to have contributed to confusion the F.B.I. had about the drug arrest in February of Dylann Roof, the man charged last month in the killing of nine people in Charleston, S.C.

headline.main: Clerical Error Played Role in Gun Sale to Dylann Roof
headline.print_headline: Clerical Error Cited in Sale of Gun Used in Charleston
